column21:
If things aren't working as intended, an easy troubleshooting step is to blow away everything and restart.

 alias cleancontainers='docker rm -f -v $(docker ps -a -q)'
 alias cleanimages='docker rmi -f $(docker images -q)'
 alias cleanq='cleancontainers;cleanimages'

Logs are boring, but 99% of the time they tell you what you need to know. Read every line.

Know what's on your system... docker ps, docker container ls, docker image ls, etc.

If the container looks like it built right but something is broken, docker exec into the running container via docker exec -it <container_id> /bin/bash. Look around, make sure volume mounts are working, files got copied, etc.
